answerText: Sextus Propertius[10] This other Roman poet wrote Carmen Saeculare and an early Ars Poetica and also coined the aphorism "carpe diem" in his Odes.
heading: 2012 Penn-ance |2012 | 2 | 6 | Literature | Classical | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: A poem addressed to this man calls him "a name not to be worn out with the years." His own works include one which says of its addressee, "[she] was the firstÂ… to trap me with her eyes." For 10 points each: [10] Name this poet of four books of Elegies, the first of which was addressed to his lover, Cynthia.
